answers.answer: Congratulations on your countdown.  You treatment journey is pretty much a mirror image of what I went through weight loss, clothes shopping and everything.I chose not to do a PCR until 6 mos. post because I knew if I relapsed I wouldn't treat any sooner than that.  My body was in need of a serious break and I knew if I did a 4 week post and it came back that I had relapsed I would be stressed to the max until I was ready to treat again.  But of course I'm gonna be SVR so that doesn't matter.MouseGenotype 1a, Stage 3, Grade 3finished 48 wks of tx on 4/13/07Waiting on results of SVR PCR taken 9/20/07Hoping for SVR baby!

Elaine ~ how are things going for you these days ?  I don't have the patience much lately to read all the posts.  And I find I don't post that often.     I am just trying to get thru these last weeks I have left.  I could have only 8 left, if he lets me do 48, but he keeps saying 12 mos.. thats 52 weeks, so we will see.  I just need a decision before ordering that last month of scripts.  I don't want to have extra meds left.   I got my appt with GI for next week, and I believe that my Hemo appt is next week as well.. gotta find my appt card for that one.    Yes and for the last few days.. Since last friday, I have felt great.    maybe that procrit I missed, finally caught up.. I was like 14 days past due, due to a fowl up with the prescription, and the specialty pharmacy.    Maybe it finally kicked in, its been a few wks now since I got it.. In fact I have 1 left for this week, so its been almost a month. I better reorder tomorrow, so it doesnt happen again.    I will try again on the PCR, but have a feeling he is going to make me wait.  I had one at 13 wks and one at 24 wks.   that were both UND.   but just kinda antsy to know that the last few months I have remained that way. being my 2nd time around, I want to be sure its gone for good.

I have lost over 90 lbs .. so going from a 22 to a 10, well  I had nothing that I could keep on .  Haha.. I could not stand looking so bad, my stepdaughter gave me some clothes she could not wear anymore,,   ( she is preg and gained weight before getting that way )  So had a few outfits I could mix and match.  But was dying to go shopping.   I could never find anything that I liked in the size I was in. All the cute clothes were for smaller people..     I never weighed so much till after I had treatment 14 years ago, I went from 147 to 85 lbs on tx.  so put me on high calorie diet. and I went up to almost 275.  and became diabetic,  had been working on getting that down and treating the diabetes, before starting tx this time.  Was at 257 at beginning of treatment and now I am at 164, so thats actually 93 lbs.  I am tickled pink to be this size, but all the excess skin has just got to go.  LOL   But I am in a 10, and probably will be in an 8 next month some time.  At the rate it comes off. I plan on doing what ever I can to keep the weight off.  I am NOT going to gain it back.  I do not want to even gain a pound of it back.    But I know the chances that will happen are thin.  but we eat healthy, and cut out sugar because of the diabetes.  Now my sugar is completely normal.. my A1C was 4.2.   And when had my colonscopy last week they tested my sugar, so they would know which saline to give me.  It was 82.. so they switched it.    My PCP is so happy that I don't have to deal with that on top of this, but its been doable.   If it were not for this site, I may have quit when my HGB dropped so much I felt like I was dying...   But I am almost there.. I can DO it..

Glad to hear you're feeling better.Same thing with me.  The past week has been the most NORMAL I've had since beginning TX 40 weeks ago.  (aside from some lump issues).Maybe we'll both find the final stretch easier than the beginning!  I've got 32 more weeks.  Are you doing extended TX or 48 SOC?(I forgot)wyntre

He thinks he is having me do 12 mos. ( 52 shots ) but the SOC is 48 so will discuss that again with him next thursday.  When I go for the results of all that bloodwork he did a few wks ago, and the biopsy on my polyps (3).    I think he is going to reduce my Riba now, I am below the weight base for dosage.  He said if I got down to 170 he would consider it.. I am at 164.     So we will see.  Glad you are feeling better too.. isnt that weird ?    Maybe just knowing , nearing the end makes it appear that way /???   naaaaaa     Well my Honey is home so better go ..

dperry10,Congrats on the weight loss, lots of incentive and meds there. If the doc lets you reduce the riba you will feel 100% better. I don’t know if you’re on procrit as well but if you are, really consider staying on it unless you’re hemoglobin goes too high. I reduced my riba 8 weeks ago and it has gotten better every week since then but I’m still on the procrit which is ok by me because it keeps everything in balance. I have 18 weeks to go and will get the full panel blood work at the end of the month. Cbc, 14 panel, thyroid, RNA,PCR and lipeds which will give me the big picture of what’s happening inside and if it comes out the way I think it will, I will not go back up to the 1200mg of riba for the duration of tx. Just riding the wave and hoping for the best. Take Care!jasper
wishing you the very best from here on out!

Yes I am happy to have lost the weight for sure.   I refuse to gain it back.   Not the best way to lose it, but whatever it takes.. LOL.   I am on procrit yes, as been hovering between 9 - 10 on HGB since week 4.  on 40,000 u/l a week.    I will be sure to order my refill for the month before going to appt next week, so I already have it, if he tries to get me off of it.     I had all those same tests 3 wks ago as well, and I did post them, but he will go over all that with me.  Everything looked good though..   Even my diabetes is gone.   I am riding the wave as well, but only have 8 wks to go , if he lets me do the SOC of 48, but I think he is going to have me do 52, using 12 mos as his marker.. Go figure...
Thank you.. Hope you are doing well..

question: Well I just did shot 40..   on a count down now.   Over the last week I have felt pretty good, with exception of the prep for the coloscopy.. LOL   Maybe it was the colon cleanse that is making me feel better ?   Its Monday morning, and I am going to work.  I now only have like 7 hours to use thru the end of the year.. Unpaid at that.. but once my FMLA is recertified I will have those hours to use.  Its now been a year, since dx and all tests completed before starting tx in Dec 06.  Its hard to believe I am near the end now, and I can say I made it.    I just hope and pray for SVR this time around forever... Not only for myself but for everyone who suffers from this .The rash has subsided, and it I have more energy than usual.  I actually didn't take a nap all weekend, and usually after my shot on Friday night, I spend the weekend in the pool and the bed.I should go get my blood drawn this morning, I forgot to do it Saturday.   I need to call and make an appt for next week, to see Gastro to go over bx of polyps, and all the results of the blood tests he ran a couple of weeks ago.   I think he will adjust my Riba now, because of weight based doses.  I am now below the range for the 1200 per day.   But we will see.  I am going to ask him again to run that same PCR test.   I have not had one since wk 24.   And I am at 40....   I hate to think I have to wait 6 mos post before he does another one.  Although the last 2 were UND.   I am still kinda scared. With all the breakthrus lately, it makes you wonder.    Well  I finally broke down one day last week, when I took the extra day off, and went shopping, and got some clothes that actually fit me.   Mike says I look like a totally different person.   I also got my hair cut again.   Nice and really short.. a boycut actually.   Its growing back in, so there are all these baby hairs everywhere, and it looked all uneven with the new and old in there being different lengths.  But its healthy, just appears to be straight.   I think I lost my curls.. But with it this short. , who knows.    Well I just wanted to post some positive words,  That I actually feel good for a change.  Its not always bad.   And its been doable.   Of the 40 wks so far, I have worked for 35 of them.   And cannot take anymore off till after I have completed tx.   So heres to hoping I feel like this for the rest of my sentence....and much longer....  LOL
title: Feeling pretty good
